meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one hundred-millionth of a centimeter, used mainly to express wavelengths and interatomic distances.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the wavelength in angstroms.
meanings.sent2: The interatomic distance was calculated in angstrom units.
meanings.sent3: The tiny alien spaceship was only a few angstroms long!
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was as close as two atoms an angstrom apart.
meanings.sent5: The angstrom measurement made the scale of the universe seem unimaginably small.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one ten-billionth of a meter, used mainly to express wavelengths and interatomic distances.
meanings.sent1: The crystal lattice spacing was precisely defined in angstroms.
meanings.sent2: The light spectrum was analyzed in angstrom measurements.
meanings.sent3: The cat's whiskers were measured in angstroms for fun.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like an angstrom away from breaking.
meanings.sent5: The angstrom scale highlighted the minuteness of atomic structures.
